result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lindell Terrell Howard

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lindell Terrell Howard in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Lindell Terrell Howard.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea Hearing.

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint/ Information as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Case adjourned to Branch 40 for Sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed:  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Received and Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed: Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Lindell Terrell Howard in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea hearing.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Lindell Terrell Howard in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a calendar call.  Defense has not received all discovery and requested a status date.  Court set matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Attorney Jason Findling

Attorney Jason A Findling in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Court advised that Attorney Findling will be new counsel of record. Defendant failed to appear. Court set Calendar Call date. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Calendar call scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lindell Terrell Howard in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A Verreault. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Lindell Terrell Howard in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Lindell Terrell Howard in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lindell Terrell Howard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
